cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles ESE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest, then north toward the southeastern Louisiana and Mississippi coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast, east of New Orleans (near the LA-MS border)

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from the Mississippi/Alabama border eastward to the Alabama/Florida border; Tropical Storm Watch from Indian Pass to Ochlockonee River, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Morgan City, LA to the MS/AL border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and metropolitan New Orleans; Storm Surge Warning from Port Fourchon, LA to the AL/FL border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, Lake Borgne, and Mobile Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds (sustained 75–90 mph with higher gusts) are expected in the New Orleans area beginning late Monday night into Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 4–6 ft inundation possible in Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas with potential overtopping of levees outside the Hurricane & Storm Damage Risk Reduction System.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches with isolated totals up to 24 inches, producing life-threatening flash flooding and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands; dangerous surf and rip currents.
